ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Professional-level Mandarin to be used in contemporary media contexts!
I learned newspaper and academic level Chinese. Improved formal speaking listening and writing skills.
Formal Chinese vocabulary/grammar in the context news/current affairs.

I learned how to speak and write using formal language on a variety of important political, economic, and sociocultural topics like: diplomatic disputes, visual art and art auctions, military attacks, terrorist attacks, etc.
I learned about Current Affairs around the world through the Chinese language by reading the news, writing, speaking, and listening.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Loved Zhou LaoShi! The pace of the course was also just right.
The course is amazing. Prof Zhou's curriculum is world class! He really cares about all his students!

Zhou laoshi is amazing. You can tell that he really cares about his students. The format of the class is great and I learned a ton. I really feel like this class has improved my Chinese out of any other Chinese classes I've taken.
Too much work. Screw that student who said the workload was too light.
No weaknesses, although the work can get a little bit tedious sometimes. The diversity of work is really nice though.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! Zhou LaoShi is amazing and he himself is worth taking the class for.

I would highly recommend this course for any student who studies Chinese. You will massively improve your formal language skills which are much more important when advancing beyond the conversational level.

Yes, I learned a lot about formal Chinese in this class. Take this class if you are serious about improving your Chinese. However, if you want something that's easy or has a low workload, this class is not for you.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student.  is a phenomenal instructor, and youll learn so much.
I definitely would, especially since Professor Zhou is teaching.

The class is very interesting and definitely immerses you in formal news-style Chinese. A lot of strong, relevant vocabulary and in-context practice. The workload is not particularly difficult, but does contain many smaller assignments that you do have to keep track of.
